intro: Stylidium corymbosum var. corymbosum, commonly known as the clustered triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its unique spurred flowers that resemble a trigger mechanism, which is a distinctive botanical feature. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, bright yellow or orange flowers. This species is well adapted to dry conditions and is a member of the family Haemodoraceae.
